articles.summary: When children dream of being entertainers, their backup career isn’t typically engineering. articles.title: What It Will Really Take to Electrify All of Africa
articles.summary: I dined recently with Joe, a Nigerian who manages a 400-hectare rice farm in the north of his country. Nigeria imports about 2.4 million metric tons of rice annually, according to the U.S. Department of Agriculture. Farmers like Joe are helping to move his country of 237 million people toward self-s...

articles.title: Satellite Collisions Could Be Prevented With a New AI System
articles.summary: The numbers paint a stark picture of our orbital traffic problem: More than 11,000 active satellites currently circle Earth, with thousands more planned for launch in coming years. articles.title: Wonky Graphene Could Sharpen Proton Therapy

articles.title: Learning More With Less
